1.text: Cut the meat into fillets that are 4 by 6 in (10 by 15 cm).

2.text: Mix all of the spices in a small bowl.

3.text: Turn the grill on high and heat a cast iron skillet on the grill.

4.text: Melt 3⁄4  c (180 mL) of butter and lather your piece of fish.

5.text: Sprinkle both sides of the meat with blackening spices.

6.text: Put a piece of fish on the skillet and spoon 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of butter on it.

7.text: Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side.

9.text: Mix all of the spices in a small bowl.

10.text: Heat a skillet with 1⁄2  tsp (2.5 mL) of olive oil on medium heat.

11.text: Sprinkle the fish with salt and ½ to 1 tsp (1 to 2 grams) of seasoning.

12.text: Place the fish in the skillet for 5-6 minutes.

13.text: Serve your fish immediately and store leftovers in the fridge.
